summary: Every year, the U.S. engages in billions of dollars in defense trade. To support this trade, the Department of Defense has signed Reciprocal Defense Procurement Agreements with 28 partner countries, such as the U.K., Germany, and Japan. These agreements waive "buy national" laws, among other things, to help the partners enhance readiness and work together. DOD has skipped important steps in initiating and renewing these...
title: International Trade: Agencies Should Improve Oversight of Reciprocal Defense Procurement Agreements
